metadata.extraction_method: LLM Fourth Pass - Deep Semantic Analysis

cross_vehicle_relationships.description: 2021+ Tahoe, Suburban, Yukon, and Escalade share IDENTICAL Global B architecture
cross_vehicle_relationships.implication: Same procedure, cables, and tool support applies to all four.

cross_vehicle_relationships.description: Silverado 1500 and Sierra 1500 are platform twins with identical IMMO logic
cross_vehicle_relationships.implication: All procedures, VIN rules (12th digit), and tool support are identical.

cross_vehicle_relationships.description: 2500/3500 HD trucks stayed Global A through 2023, switched to Global B in 2024
cross_vehicle_relationships.implication: CRITICAL: A 2023 HD is easy (legacy tools). A 2024 HD is locked.

cross_vehicle_relationships.description: 2022+ Grand Cherokee L, Wagoneer, and Grand Wagoneer use 'Write Once' RF Hubs
cross_vehicle_relationships.implication: AKL via OBD is IMPOSSIBLE. Hub must be replaced with virgin unit.

cross_vehicle_relationships.description: 2022+ Tundra, 2023+ Sequoia, 2024 Grand Highlander, 2023+ Prius share the 8A-BA chip and TMLF19 Smart Box
cross_vehicle_relationships.implication: All require the 30-Pin Cable + G-Box3 for AKL.

cross_vehicle_relationships.description: 2020+ Nissan Sentra (B18), 2021+ Rogue, 2021+ Pathfinder share the 16+32 Gateway
2022+ Civic, 2023+ Accord, 2023+ CR-V, and 2023+ Pilot share the 11th Gen 4A (Hitag AES) architecture
cross_vehicle_relationships.implication: Same 4A chip (KR5TP-4), same BCM alarm lockout behavior.

cross_vehicle_relationships.description: Acura Integra uses KR5TP-2 (different from Honda's KR5TP-4) despite shared platform
cross_vehicle_relationships.implication: CANNOT use Civic/Accord keys on Integra.

cross_vehicle_relationships.description: XC90, XC60, S90, V90, S60, V60 (2016+) share Scalable Product Architecture (SPA)
cross_vehicle_relationships.implication: Same CEM architecture. Same OBD PIN decode procedure.

cross_vehicle_relationships.description: XC40, C40, XC40 Recharge share Compact Modular Architecture (CMA)
cross_vehicle_relationships.implication: Same CEM logic as SPA but physically on driver's side.

cross_vehicle_relationships.description: 2022+ XC60/S90/V90, 2023+ XC90/S60/V60 transitioned to Google AAOS OS from Sensus
cross_vehicle_relationships.implication: AAOS models = Server/Bench only. Different gateway security.

cross_vehicle_relationships.description: 2018+ Range Rover, Velar, Defender use OTP-locked KVM (SPC560B60L3 MCU)
2018+ Range Rover flagship models require UWB keys (KOBJXF18A) for Passive Entry
cross_vehicle_relationships.implication: Non-UWB keys will NOT work for passive entry.

rankings.reason: Software exploit to silence alarm via OBD.
Requires Ford Active Alarm Bypass Cable.
Best coverage. Often no PIN code required.
Server farm guarantees PIN decode within 24 hours.
Often faster at Volvo PIN calculation.
Authorized method. New virgin KVM required.

critical_warnings_and_gotchas.warning: The 10th VIN digit (year) is USELESS. The 12th digit determines architecture: <=4 = Global A, >=5 = Global B.
BCM flashing requires a 50-70 Amp battery maintainer. Voltage drop during SPS2 flash will BRICK the BCM.
Without the CAN FD Adapter, all aftermarket tools receive 'Communication Error' on half the modules.

applies_to: All GM Global B vehicles in AKL state
critical_warnings_and_gotchas.warning: Active alarm can lock down OBDII port communication.

applies_to: GM vehicles with late-2024/2025 firmware updates
critical_warnings_and_gotchas.warning: GM is actively closing backdoor exploits. Aftermarket tools may fail on newest firmware.
The RF Hub is 'Write Once'. AKL via OBD is IMPOSSIBLE.
Standard OBD programming is BLOCKED for AKL. The 30-Pin Cable is MANDATORY.
BCM is EXTREMELY sensitive to voltage fluctuations. Early attempts resulted in BRICKED BCMs.
In AKL, the BCM cuts OBD port communication when alarm is active.
Using 'All Keys Lost' procedure without 16+32 cable can BRICK the BCM.
2021+ SUVs are EXCLUSIVELY 433MHz. 315MHz fob will result in programming failure.
'Dead OBDII Port' is almost always a blown fuse (Fuse 53). Pin 16 shares 12V accessory circuit.
In AKL, the BCM REJECTS diagnostic requests while alarm is active. Use battery hard reset for 30-60 second window.
ALL other keys must be 10+ feet away. When prompted, bring ONE new key within 40-SECOND WINDOW.
Driver 1 and Driver 2 keys have different part numbers. Wrong slot can cause memory seat conflicts.
CEM PIN decode takes 2-24 hours. If battery drops below 12V, CEM D-Flash CORRUPTS = BRICKED module.
Transition years: Some 2022 XC60s have AAOS, some have Sensus. Tools for Sensus FAIL on AAOS.
On Volvo EVs, if 12V battery dies, you CANNOT open frunk. Find manual release cable behind tow-eye cover.
Key Tag has NON-REPLACEABLE sealed battery (dies 2-3 years). VIN-locked. Sell new full-size fob instead.
KVM uses OTP-locked MCU. Standard 'Add Key' via OBD is BLOCKED once initial keys programmed.
UWB keys (KOBJXF18A) are MANDATORY for passive entry on 2018+ flagships.
Security Gateway blocks OBD writes. Must use Pathfinder with TOPIx Cloud OR Star Connector bypass cable.

pearl_procedures.procedure: OLED screen black but audio plays: Hold End Call button on steering wheel for 15 seconds to force HMI reboot.
High Idle won't engage: Check Brake Pedal Position Sensor. 1% applied signal inhibits High Idle. No DTC set.
Manual IMMO relearn: Ignition ON -> Wait for Security light OFF (10 min) -> Ignition OFF 5 sec -> Repeat 3x. 4th attempt learns key.
Inner Multi-Pro/Multi-Flex tailgate stuck: BCM thinks hitch installed. Hold upper touchpad for 3-7 seconds.
Dead fob battery: Emergency start pocket is in CUPHOLDER under rubber mat. On Silverado bench seat, lower storage.
AKL with alarm: Disconnect 12V for 10-15 min. Reconnect -> 30-60 second window before alarm re-arms. Connect tool immediately.
Dead fob battery: Place fob on marked symbol in cupholder (under rubber mat) or center console. Press brake. Press Start.
Remote works but car won't start: Lock and unlock car 3 TIMES RAPIDLY with remote. Forces rolling code resync.
Long OBD PIN read hangs at 'Connecting': Flash high beams or tap brake every 2 minutes to keep CAN gateway active.
Dead fob or 'Smart Key Not Found': Place fob on marked 'Key' symbol in center console (under cup holder mat). Uses inductive coil for emergency start.
KVM failure ('Smart Key Not Found'): Hold fob against steering column shroud 'sweet spot'. Bypasses RF/LF, uses passive transponder induction.
Bypass OTP lock: Use Lock50 HW04 to read config. Program Emulator Key (HW14/HW18) to mimic existing Key ID. Car thinks original key found.
